text: [Music]
hello this is chef john from food wishes
comm with fig brulee you've probably

so what I'm gonna go lengthwise when I'm

beautiful either way so you decide which
way to cut your figs it depends on how
provocative you want to be but some way
somehow they got to get cut in half
alright once those are cut in half and

there's not much to this you simply hold
the flame on the sugar until it bubbles
and boils and turns dark brown and yes
there might be a couple small spots of
black that's okay brulee means burnt
creme brulee means burnt cream so it's
supposed to be that way and when that

gonna get shiny it's gonna be beautiful
and you can hear with the tip of this

brulee the top of all those figs which
is what we have right here so you can
serve these with a bunch of different
things that would make a great garnish
for some ice cream but what I did I took
some fresh burrata cheese which is a
very extra creamy fresh mozzarella and I
plopped a big old scoop right down the
middle which I think looks pretty gnarly
but beautiful and then I'm gonna drizzle
over a little bit of extra virgin olive
oil and just a touch of freshly ground
black pepper and a little bit of sea
salt just for fun and that's just a
great great pairing with those sweet
figs just some gorgeous gorgeous stuff
so while this certainly would work for a

figs it also can be done more of a
